page.title: 04DRUMNADROCHIT SETTLEMENTS
page.content: The original site of the settlement was the{Green}where the river is bridged and the{Drovers Roads}met. Many original houses still survive. {Lewiston}was founded in the late 18th century. It was a self sufficient community with smithy etc. and each house having its own field. The old terraced houses have mostly been modernised.{Milton}was built about the same time but has since been added to and improved.The nearby river powered the tweed and grain mills which are all now closed. Recently the village has expanded.In the 1950s a scheme of semi detached 2 storey council houses was built at {Druimlon}.In the 1960s and 1970s more council houses were built at{Balmacaan including pensioners bungalows.There has also been a lot of private housing developments since 1970.
